name: Viral Pneumonia
symptoms: Fever, Dry cough, Shortness of breath, Chest pain, Fatigue, Muscle aches
cause: Influenza virus, Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), Adenovirus
precautions: Get vaccinated, Avoid close contact with sick individuals, Wash hands frequently, Wear a mask in crowded areas

drug_descriptions.Oseltamivir: An antiviral drug for influenza treatment, taken as 75 mg twice daily for 5 days. May cause nausea and headache.
drug_descriptions.Ribavirin: Used for severe RSV infections, administered via inhalation or orally. Side effects include anemia and fatigue.
drug_descriptions.Zanamivir: An inhaled antiviral for influenza, 10 mg twice daily for 5 days. May cause bronchospasm in some patients.

description: A lung infection caused by viruses, leading to inflammation and respiratory difficulties, often requiring supportive care.

name: Chronic Sinusitis
symptoms: Nasal congestion, Facial pain, Headache, Postnasal drip, Loss of smell
cause: Bacterial or fungal infections, Nasal polyps, Allergies
precautions: Use saline nasal sprays, Avoid allergens, Maintain humidity, Avoid smoking

drug_descriptions.Fluticasone: A nasal corticosteroid to reduce inflammation, used as 1-2 sprays per nostril daily. May cause nosebleeds.
drug_descriptions.Amoxicillin: A broad-spectrum antibiotic, 500 mg every 8 hours for 10-14 days. Side effects include rash and diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Clarithromycin: Used for bacterial sinusitis, 500 mg twice daily for 7-14 days. May cause nausea and taste changes.

description: A prolonged inflammation of the sinuses, often causing persistent discomfort and requiring long-term management.

name: Gastroenteritis
symptoms: Diarrhea, Vomiting, Abdominal pain, Fever, Dehydration
cause: Norovirus, Rotavirus, Escherichia coli, Salmonella
precautions: Wash hands thoroughly, Cook food properly, Avoid contaminated water, Stay hydrated

drug_descriptions.Loperamide: An antidiarrheal, 4 mg initially then 2 mg after each loose stool. May cause constipation.
drug_descriptions.Ondansetron: Used for nausea, 4-8 mg every 8 hours. Side effects include headache and constipation.
drug_descriptions.Ciprofloxacin: An antibiotic for bacterial gastroenteritis, 500 mg twice daily for 5-7 days. May cause nausea.

description: An inflammation of the stomach and intestines, often caused by viral or bacterial infections, leading to digestive upset.

name: Rheumatoid Arthritis
symptoms: Joint pain, Stiffness, Swelling, Fatigue, Fever
cause: Autoimmune response, Genetic factors, Environmental triggers
precautions: Regular exercise, Maintain healthy weight, Avoid smoking, Manage stress

drug_descriptions.Methotrexate: A DMARD for autoimmune control, 7.5-20 mg weekly. May cause liver toxicity and nausea.
drug_descriptions.Adalimumab: A biologic for inflammation, 40 mg every other week. Side effects include injection site reactions.
drug_descriptions.Ibuprofen: An NSAID for pain, 400-800 mg every 6-8 hours. May cause stomach upset.

description: A chronic autoimmune disorder causing joint inflammation and pain, often requiring lifelong treatment.

name: Urinary Tract Infection
symptoms: Burning during urination, Frequent urination, Cloudy urine, Pelvic pain, Fever
cause: Escherichia coli, Klebsiella pneumoniae, Staphylococcus saprophyticus
precautions: Stay hydrated, Urinate frequently, Maintain hygiene, Avoid irritants like scented soaps

drug_descriptions.Nitrofurantoin: An antibiotic for UTIs, 100 mg twice daily for 5 days. May cause nausea and urine discoloration.
drug_descriptions.Trimethoprim: Used for uncomplicated UTIs, 100 mg twice daily for 3-7 days. Side effects include rash.
drug_descriptions.Fosfomycin: A single-dose antibiotic, 3 g in one dose. May cause diarrhea.

description: An infection in the urinary system, often bacterial, causing discomfort and requiring prompt treatment.

name: Hepatitis B
symptoms: Jaundice, Fatigue, Abdominal pain, Nausea, Dark urine
cause: Hepatitis B virus, Transmitted via blood or bodily fluids
precautions: Get vaccinated, Use safe practices, Avoid sharing needles, Screen blood products

drug_descriptions.Tenofovir: An antiviral for chronic HBV, 300 mg daily. May cause kidney issues.
drug_descriptions.Entecavir: Used for HBV, 0.5-1 mg daily. Side effects include headache and fatigue.
drug_descriptions.Lamivudine: An antiviral, 100 mg daily. May cause nausea and resistance development.

description: A viral infection affecting the liver, potentially leading to chronic disease or liver cancer.

name: Migraine
symptoms: Throbbing headache, Nausea, Sensitivity to light, Aura, Vomiting
cause: Neurological dysfunction, Genetic predisposition, Triggers like stress or certain foods
precautions: Avoid triggers, Maintain sleep schedule, Stay hydrated, Manage stress

drug_descriptions.Sumatriptan: A triptan for acute migraine, 50-100 mg per dose. May cause dizziness.
drug_descriptions.Rizatriptan: Used for migraines with aura, 5-10 mg per dose. Side effects include fatigue.
drug_descriptions.Ibuprofen: For mild migraines, 400-800 mg every 6 hours. May cause stomach irritation.

description: A neurological condition causing severe headaches, often accompanied by sensory disturbances.

name: Tuberculosis
symptoms: Persistent cough, Weight loss, Night sweats, Fever, Chest pain
cause: Mycobacterium tuberculosis, Airborne transmission
precautions: Wear masks, Ensure ventilation, Complete treatment, Avoid close contact

drug_descriptions.Isoniazid: Antitubercular, 300 mg daily for 6-9 months. May cause liver toxicity.
drug_descriptions.Rifampin: Used for TB, 600 mg daily. Side effects include orange urine and liver issues.
drug_descriptions.Ethambutol: For TB treatment, 15-25 mg/kg daily. May cause vision changes.

description: A bacterial infection primarily affecting the lungs, potentially spreading to other organs.

name: Type 2 Diabetes
symptoms: Increased thirst, Frequent urination, Fatigue, Blurred vision, Slow healing wounds
cause: Insulin resistance, Genetic factors, Obesity
precautions: Maintain healthy diet, Exercise regularly, Monitor blood sugar, Avoid smoking

drug_descriptions.Metformin: For blood sugar control, 500-1000 mg twice daily. May cause gastrointestinal upset.
drug_descriptions.Glipizide: A sulfonylurea, 5-10 mg daily. Side effects include hypoglycemia.
drug_descriptions.Sitagliptin: A DPP-4 inhibitor, 100 mg daily. May cause joint pain.

description: A chronic condition affecting blood sugar regulation, often linked to lifestyle factors.

name: Bronchitis
symptoms: Cough, Mucus production, Wheezing, Chest discomfort, Fatigue
cause: Viruses, Bacteria, Environmental irritants
precautions: Avoid smoking, Use humidifiers, Stay hydrated, Avoid irritants

drug_descriptions.Albuterol: A bronchodilator, 2-4 puffs every 4-6 hours. May cause palpitations.
drug_descriptions.Azithromycin: For bacterial bronchitis, 500 mg on day 1, then 250 mg daily for 4 days. May cause diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Guaifenesin: An expectorant, 200-400 mg every 4 hours. May cause nausea.

description: An inflammation of the bronchial tubes, often causing persistent cough and mucus.

name: Lyme Disease
symptoms: Bullseye rash, Fever, Joint pain, Fatigue, Headache
cause: Borrelia burgdorferi, Transmitted via tick bites
precautions: Use insect repellent, Check for ticks, Wear protective clothing, Avoid wooded areas

drug_descriptions.Doxycycline: An antibiotic, 100 mg twice daily for 14-21 days. May cause photosensitivity.
drug_descriptions.Amoxicillin: For early Lyme, 500 mg every 8 hours for 14-21 days. Side effects include rash.
drug_descriptions.Cefuroxime: Used for Lyme, 500 mg twice daily for 14-21 days. May cause diarrhea.

description: A bacterial infection from tick bites, potentially causing long-term complications.

name: Psoriasis
symptoms: Red patches, Scaly skin, Itching, Joint pain, Burning sensation
cause: Autoimmune response, Genetic factors, Environmental triggers
precautions: Moisturize skin, Avoid triggers, Manage stress, Use mild soaps

drug_descriptions.Betamethasone: A topical corticosteroid, applied 1-2 times daily. May cause skin thinning.
drug_descriptions.Calcipotriene: A vitamin D analog, applied twice daily. May cause skin irritation.
drug_descriptions.Methotrexate: For severe cases, 7.5-20 mg weekly. Side effects include liver toxicity.

description: A chronic autoimmune condition causing rapid skin cell turnover and inflammation.

name: Meningitis
symptoms: Fever, Stiff neck, Headache, Sensitivity to light, Confusion
cause: Bacterial or viral infections, Fungi, Parasites
precautions: Get vaccinated, Avoid close contact, Maintain hygiene, Early treatment

drug_descriptions.Ceftriaxone: For bacterial meningitis, 2 g every 12 hours. May cause rash.
drug_descriptions.Vancomycin: Used for resistant bacteria, 15-20 mg/kg every 8-12 hours. May cause kidney issues.
drug_descriptions.Acyclovir: For viral meningitis, 10 mg/kg every 8 hours. Side effects include nausea.

description: An inflammation of the brain and spinal cord membranes, often requiring urgent care.

name: Asthma
symptoms: Wheezing, Shortness of breath, Chest tightness, Cough, Nighttime symptoms
cause: Allergens, Exercise, Cold air, Genetic predisposition
precautions: Avoid triggers, Use inhalers, Monitor symptoms, Maintain air quality

drug_descriptions.Albuterol: A rescue inhaler, 2-4 puffs every 4-6 hours. May cause palpitations.
drug_descriptions.Budesonide: A corticosteroid inhaler, 1-2 puffs twice daily. May cause throat irritation.
drug_descriptions.Montelukast: For allergy-related asthma, 10 mg daily. Side effects include headache.

description: A chronic respiratory condition causing airway inflammation and breathing difficulties.

name: Peptic Ulcer Disease
symptoms: Burning stomach pain, Bloating, Nausea, Heartburn, Vomiting
cause: Helicobacter pylori, NSAIDs, Stress
precautions: Avoid NSAIDs, Reduce stress, Limit alcohol, Avoid spicy foods

drug_descriptions.Omeprazole: A PPI to reduce acid, 20-40 mg daily. May cause headache.
drug_descriptions.Amoxicillin: For H. pylori, 1 g twice daily for 14 days. Side effects include diarrhea.
drug_descriptions.Clarithromycin: For H. pylori, 500 mg twice daily for 14 days. May cause taste changes.

description: Sores in the stomach or small intestine lining, often caused by bacterial infection or medication.

name: Conjunctivitis
symptoms: Red eyes, Itching, Discharge, Tearing, Swollen eyelids
cause: Bacteria, Viruses, Allergens, Irritants
precautions: Avoid touching eyes, Wash hands, Avoid sharing towels, Use clean contact lenses

drug_descriptions.Erythromycin: A topical antibiotic, applied 2-4 times daily. May cause eye irritation.
drug_descriptions.Antihistamines: For allergic conjunctivitis, oral or drops. May cause drowsiness.
drug_descriptions.Fluorometholone: A corticosteroid drop, 1-2 drops 4 times daily. May increase eye pressure.

description: An inflammation of the conjunctiva, often causing discomfort and redness in the eyes.

name: Eczema
symptoms: Itchy skin, Redness, Dry patches, Scaling, Swelling
cause: Genetic factors, Allergens, Irritants, Stress
precautions: Moisturize regularly, Avoid triggers, Use hypoallergenic products, Manage stress

drug_descriptions.Hydrocortisone: A topical steroid, applied 1-2 times daily. May cause skin thinning.
drug_descriptions.Tacrolimus: For severe eczema, applied twice daily. May cause burning sensation.
drug_descriptions.Antihistamines: For itching, oral doses vary. May cause drowsiness.

description: A chronic skin condition causing inflamed, itchy patches, often linked to allergies.

name: Malaria
symptoms: Fever, Chills, Sweats, Headache, Muscle pain
cause: Plasmodium parasites, Transmitted via mosquito bites
precautions: Use mosquito nets, Apply repellents, Take prophylaxis, Avoid mosquito-prone areas

drug_descriptions.Chloroquine: For malaria treatment, 600 mg initially, then 300 mg weekly. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Artemether: For severe malaria, 3.2 mg/kg initially, then 1.6 mg/kg daily. May cause dizziness.
drug_descriptions.Mefloquine: For prophylaxis, 250 mg weekly. Side effects include nightmares.

description: A parasitic infection affecting red blood cells, often causing severe fever cycles.

name: Chronic Kidney Disease
symptoms: Fatigue, Swelling, High blood pressure, Itchy skin, Poor appetite
cause: Diabetes, Hypertension, Glomerulonephritis
precautions: Control blood pressure, Monitor diet, Limit protein, Stay hydrated

drug_descriptions.Lisinopril: An ACE inhibitor, 10-40 mg daily. May cause cough.
drug_descriptions.Furosemide: A diuretic, 20-80 mg daily. May cause dehydration.
drug_descriptions.Erythropoietin: For anemia, dose varies. May cause hypertension.

description: A progressive loss of kidney function, often linked to chronic conditions.

name: Influenza
symptoms: Fever, Cough, Sore throat, Muscle aches, Fatigue
cause: Influenza A or B viruses
precautions: Get vaccinated, Wash hands, Avoid crowds, Wear masks

drug_descriptions.Oseltamivir: Antiviral, 75 mg twice daily for 5 days. May cause nausea.
drug_descriptions.Zanamivir: Inhaled antiviral, 10 mg twice daily for 5 days. May cause bronchospasm.
drug_descriptions.Baloxavir: Single-dose antiviral, 40-80 mg. May cause diarrhea.

description: A contagious respiratory illness caused by influenza viruses, often seasonal.
